intro: Christella ensifera, commonly known as the narrowleaf christella, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
